author: Hadlee Simons
title: Windows 10 on 110m machines
text:
Windows 10 on 110m machines Article By: Hadlee Simons Wed, 07 Oct 2015 11:40 AM Share Your Email Credit: blog.windows.com 
During its event last night, Microsoft dropped a number of cool statistics about the adoption of Windows 10. 
Probably the most important figure was that the update is now running on 110 million devices in roughly two months. 
It's a long way from Microsoft's one billion target but there's a long time to go yet and it still makes for impressive growth. 
The company also revealed that its Edge browser had served up 650 billion web-pages and that Cortana has been asked over one billion questions. 
It's not the only news that Microsoft had at its event, delivering big on the smartphone and Surface front. 
However, the company wowed the audience with its first laptop, dubbed the Surface Book. 
Read all about the newly unveiled devices here . Read More
